content: @T-libs Heads up for those in the US and related timezones: Your timezone got off-by-one error'd yesterday, and our meeting in the calendar did not. So it moved one hour in some direction in your local time.
@Mara Is the meeting following EU DST (so it'll change as well and just be different for a few weeks), or UTC (and it won't change at all)?
@Josh Triplett the calendar item is set to UTC, but it'll follow whatever we decide in the next meeting i suppose. I think it's time to check again with everyone what time works best.

In general, I think most other meetings on people's calendars tend to follow either local DST or some other time zone's DST, so if people carefully made sure the meeting was in a slot they had free, following UTC is likely to make that a problem for half the year (making people reschedule other things twice a year).
/me doesn't care if it follows EU DST or US DST, a couple of weeks either way isn't going to be an issue, but following neither seems likely to generate more conflicts.
yeah the calendar event was originally made by Ashley, who lives in a place that doesn't do DST iirc.
So in the next meeting, it may make sense to re-issue it?

@T-libs Hey hey. We have a meeting in a few hours at 2021-03-17T21:00:00+01:00.
